thread.title: Smashburger sells 40% stake to Philippines-based restaurant company
thread.title_full: Smashburger sells 40% stake to Philippines-based restaurant company - The Denver Post

author: Emilie Rusch
title: Smashburger sells 40% stake to Philippines-based restaurant company
text:
Smashburger has agreed to sell a 40-percent stake in its better burger business to Asia's largest restaurant company, Jollibee Foods Corp . of the Philippines.
The deal, announced late Monday, is worth $100 million and gives the Denver-based fast casual concept a $335 million enterprise value.
Enterprise value is a more comprehensive measure of a company's total value than market capitalization, factoring in more than equity.
"This partnership will provide additional energy and resources to Smashburger as we expand," CEO Scott Crane said in a statement. "The team at Jollibee is focused on the same values as our company, which are to serve the highest quality food and provide a great dining experience for our guests."
Founded in 2007 by Rick Schaden and Tom Ryan, Smashburger has more than 335 corporate and franchised restaurants in 35 states and seven countries.
